import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline
import seaborn as sns



import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))
source.b6b5fa82:
summer['Host_Country'].value_counts(ascending=True).plot(kind='barh',legend=True,colormap='summer_r',
figsize=(8,6),title='Number of Host Countries in the Summer Season', xlabel="Host Countries",
                                                         edgecolor='blue')
source.bc0801f3:
summer.groupby(['Year', 'Host_Country'])['Host_Country'].count().sort_values(ascending=True).plot(
    kind='barh',legend=True, colormap='summer',figsize=(8,6),
    title='Number of Host Countries in the Summer Season with Year', xlabel="Host Countries & Year",
    edgecolor='blue')
source.6435b9bf:
summer_top10 = summer.groupby(['Country'])[['Gold', 'Silver', 'Bronze']].sum().sort_values(
    ascending=False, by='Gold').head(10)

summer_top10.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(20,6), color=['gold', 'silver', 'goldenrod'])
plt.xlabel('Country', fontsize=18)
plt.ylabel('Total Participants', fontsize=18)
plt.title('Top 10 Country with Medals Type', fontsize=18)
source.b2cf1b07:
summer_top10 = summer.groupby('Country')[['Gold', 'Silver', 'Bronze','M_Total']].sum().sort_values(
    ascending=False, by='M_Total').head(10)

summer_top10.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(20,6), color=['gold', 'silver', 'goldenrod', 'blue'])
plt.xlabel('Country', fontsize=18)
plt.ylabel('Tolal Medals', fontsize=18)
plt.title('Top 10 Country with Total Medals & Medals Type', fontsize=18)
source.d08699a8:
summer_top10 = summer.groupby('Country')[['Gold', 'Silver', 'Bronze','P_Total']].sum().sort_values(
    ascending=False, by='P_Total').head(10)

summer_top10.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(20,6), color=['gold', 'silver', 'goldenrod', 'blue'])
plt.xlabel('Country', fontsize=18)
plt.ylabel('Total Participants', fontsize=18)
plt.title('Top 10 Country with Total Medals & Medals Type', fontsize=18)
source.c1a07bb5:
summer_top10_Men_Country_over_years = summer.groupby(['Men', 'Country','Year'])[['Gold', 'Silver',
    'Bronze']].sum().sort_values(ascending=False, by='Men').head(10)
summer_top10_Men_Country_over_years.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(20,6), color=['gold', 'silver', 
                                                                            'goldenrod'])
plt.xlabel('Total Men in the Country with Year', fontsize=18)
plt.ylabel('Total Medals', fontsize=18)
plt.title('Top 10 Country with Total Men & Medals Type with Year', fontsize=18)
source.4dc95736:
summer_top10_Women_Country_years = summer.groupby(['Women', 'Country','Year'])[['Gold', 'Silver',

summer_top10_Women_Country_years.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(20,6), color=['gold', 'silver', 
                                                                         'goldenrod'])
plt.xlabel('Total Women in the Country with Year', fontsize=18)
plt.ylabel('Total Medals', fontsize=18)
plt.title('Top 10 Country with Total Women & Medals Type with Year', fontsize=18)

    ascending=False, by='Men').head(10)

top10_country_men_women.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(20,6), color=['turquoise', 'lightsalmon'])
plt.xlabel('Country', fontsize=18)
plt.ylabel('Total Men & Women', fontsize=18)
plt.title('Top 10 Country with Total Men & Women', fontsize=18)

source.8f985c32:
## Introduction

Paralympic Games or Paralympics is an international multi-sport event for athletes with a range of disabilities. ... Athletes who participate have a range of disabilities including impaired muscle power, hypertonia, ataxia, vision impairment, intellectual impairment, etc.

This is a collection of data of every Paralympic Games (Summer and Winter) held between 1960 to 2021.
It consist of 12 columns such as Year, Host Country, Country, etc....
Lets load a summer & winter database csv file:
